Reviews.Title: “No customer service at all”
Reviews.Author: Katerine C
Reviews.Content: I went to a Novotel in Paris years ago at it was really nice. So when I decided to go to Novotel in Montreal, I was expecting the same standards. Unfortunately, it was the whole opposite. The worst part has to be the customer service. The receptionists never said "hello" when we entered (we always had to say hi first) and they never told us there was a gym or told us about the breakfast (the prices and the hours). Some smiles would have been nice too! The construction going on in the whole lobby was very disturbing and the temporary front desk is a mess! During the reservation, they should have told us about this because it was very unpleasant and disturbing. No compensation was given for this. When we decided to talk to a manager about this, she told us it was just the last finishing touches and that's why they don't mention it during the reservation call. But I saw just minutes ago a comment by Novotel Montreal to another customer on TripAdvisor saying that the renovations were going to finish March 2012. We're April 16th. So if there's still a month of renovations, I think it's unacceptable not telling the guests. By the way, our complaint wasn't really taken seriously by this person, which was very offending. I would never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Snooty Staff To Go With Overprice”
Reviews.Author: Friendly_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel to be close to Bell Centre - it ticked that box that's all. Also close to shopping district and restaurants but would have been better off at Holiday Inn or similar. Whoever thought of frosted glass doors for bathroom? Also they don't expect their guest to stay long as there was little space for clothes. It irks me when hotels charge for local or 800 numbers but a bigger complaint when there is nothing in a room to indicate charges.

Reviews.Title: “A solid little place”
Reviews.Author: keranm
Reviews.Content: Okay so it's probably a bit unfair to review them on this, but when I arrived in Montreal the hotel was in the midst of upgrades. There was building stuff everywhere, their main foyer was not in use, and the checkin/out tables where in the hallway of level 2. But still the staff where great - helping me find food at 3am after a long flight, suggesting places to visit and check out for my 2 days in Montreal. The location is great, and generally the hotel room was quiet (except when there is a jackhammer going downstairs in the morning). Warm and friendly and their onsite restaurant was really good too.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat location and price”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: Excellent value - half a block from the Bell Centre and one block from Ste Catharine St. and the Montreal nightlife all at a great price. Rooms are recently renovated and were clean and tidy. We stayed as part of a batchelor party weekend and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Does not measure up to the good looks”
Reviews.Author: Kiwifraise
Reviews.Content: Lobby was under massive renovation when I stayed there. Didn't really matter, even thought it was a good sign! Room was freshly renovated (with poor taste, but still...) What a surprise when I wanted to give a bath to my son a found the tub old and dirty. Some stains made it uninviting, had some hairs in it and dried soap or shampoo on the tile. So we forgot the bath for that night. At bed time, we had a hard time sleeping because we could feel the springs in the mattress. Not at all comfortable. Restaurant looked good but food was kind of cold. Coffee was, well... not coffee! Tasted like coffee flavored hot water. Pricing was good but I will not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, beautiful, heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: matlin_9
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful lobby and hallways, great french gym. Loved it with beautiful views of the city, would stay here again, Great concierge too! gave us a great restaurant recommen dation,

Reviews.Title: “Renos make it ugly”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnurse50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business - the meeting I was attending was in the hotel. They are renovating the entire ground floor so it is UGLY. But I was greeted warmly by two young women on a cold Sunday night. Registration was accomplished quickly (I wanted to watch the Oscars) and I went up to my boring and bland room. Nothing special - bed was hard but pillows were comfy. Shower was good in the morning - but why do hotels insist on providing a bottle of shampoo/conditioner - this is an oxymoron as the two things accomplish different goals. PLEASE consider separate conditioner - and also (especially in winter) provide lotion!!!! My hands were like sandpaper the rest of the day. Breakfast and lunch provided by the hotel for my meeting was fresh and delicious. The server was also very quiet when replacing dishes and cleaning up - kudos to him!

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: Figgles81
Reviews.Content: Currebtly undergoing foyer renovations but don't let that put you off staying. Front desk staff were lovely and helpful. We stayed 3 times in February and were able to leave luggage for our return. Rooms near the lifts can be a little noisy in the morning but are clean an well maintained. Location was the best point, short walk to metro and main shopping an eating areas. Hotel restaurant had a good menu and food was enjoyable. Would definitely recommend for tourists and those attending the nearby bell centre or coming to Montreal or shopping.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression Not Good”
Reviews.Author: Bundyman
Reviews.Content: I planned my trip for February last September and booked this hotel. I had tickets to attend a Montreal Canadiens game with my 73 year old father. We are both lifetime Habs fans and had never been to a game in Montreal so we were very excited to attend the game. Overall the stay at the hotel was average. The room was clean and the staff was pleasant. I don't speak French and they were more than willing to speak English to accommodate me. I use a CPAP machine when sleeping and had to unplug the headboard lights to plug it in when I first arrived. After returning from lunch and a visit to the Bell Centre I found that my CPAP had been unplugged and they had supplied me with a power bar without my having to ask. The first impression however when we first entered the hotel was not a positive one. The lobby was being renovated and looked horrible, noisy and cramped. I'm sure it will look much better when it's completed but in our case it was not a positive experience. We were directed to the second floor to check-in. A nice young woman was waiting at a makeshift desk directly in front of the elevators and check in was quick. Considering all of the unsolicited emails I received from the Novotel over the months leading up to our stay, it might have been nice of them to mention in one of them about the renovations taking place. The location of the hotel is ideal for those wanting to see the city and was only a five minute walk to the arena. While my visit wasn't completely ideal, I would recommend the hotel to others. Just wait until all of the work is done.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: oakroyd
Reviews.Content: Excellent value especially if you can get an early bird deal via accor or expedia to include the fantastic buffet breakfast. Comfortable rooms with bath tub and shower over and free coffee making facilities. Staff are exceptionally helpful and the position is perfect for downtown and the metro. The stop for the brilliant 747 bus service to and from the airport is only 2-3 minutes walk from the hotelâ€™s door â€“ donâ€™t bother with a taxi, the bus service is great and only $8. The outside bar area is no more expensive for beer than anywhere else and you get free wifi access whilst you sip and nibble on delicious free crisps and huge olives. There is also a very useful 515 bus which runs from outside the tourist office in Dorchester Square (c 5 mins walk) and takes you to the old town and old port area. We found it easier and nicer than the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & hotel bar....the rest needs work”
Reviews.Author: CrzyCdn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a weekend (in town for a hockey game). The location is ideal....no more than 5 min. walk to the rink. Wasn't impressed when our group booked rooms with 2 double beds & we were greeted with one bed + one foldout couch in each room. The lobby is a mess, but I suspect the value rooms will only be around until construction is completed. Side note: Good Irish pub right across the street from the main entrance....decent food, live music & lots of TVs

Reviews.Title: “under construction”
Reviews.Author: Nicovroum08
Reviews.Content: Hotel reception under construction (was not mentionned when I booked) Bad and expansive restaurant! But well located close to St Catherine Street

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: StoryA4
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy about this hotel however I will say its the best value in Montreal. Great centralized location, clean, and reasonable parking prices. Downside...there is no free wifi and there was only 1 slow Mac in the lobby to share but the concierge is very helpful. Definitely recommend if your staying in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very good stay!”
Reviews.Author: MoniVoyageur Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at Novotel for 4 nights from January 1st to January 5th 2012 was an excellent way to start the year. The downtown location of the hotel with less than 5 min walk to shopping, entertainement, sport (Hockey games at Centre Bell), and two metro stations on the orange and green lines connecting to major parts of the city. My room was on the 9th (highest) floor overlooking the nice high rise buildings of the downtown. The food offered in the restaurant was selective and good. Work is being done to renew the lobby and the reception staff was magnificently polite. I 'll be staying there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat no frill, but amazing beds.”
Reviews.Author: mike f
Reviews.Content: The hotel is still undergoing renovations and from what we were told the renovations will not end till March 2012. However, out of the 5 nights stay, we were only bothered by construction once. The washroom is okay, it comes with clean towels, soap, cups, hair dryer, but no bath robes. The cable is basic, but enough to entertain anyone (sports, cartoons, dramas, action). The room itself looks clean and well kept, the carpet needs to be changed though. The location is amazing, within a one minute walk you hit Ste. Catherine street. On Ste. Catherine you'll find all the shopping stores you want, followed restaurants and bars. However many of the restaurants and bars are at the corners or the streets adjacent. One thing to mention about the hotel, is that on the fridge they have a sensor that tells them when ever you take things out of the fridge. So if you have the need to chill your food, medication, or drinks make sure you call the front desk, and ask for the charge to be removed. Overall, it was an a good hotel. I can easily say I've been to better, and can easily say I've been to worse. The hotel should still offer cheap rate per location as the construction of the front lobby continues.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bwonderingg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under construction and the entrance to the hotel changed twice in my short 3 day stay. No complaints otherwise. It was in a good location. Rooms were average. Wi-Fi in the room can only be used with one computer. If you have more than one it kicks you off within a minute. Very frustrating if you are travelling with someone else and you have a lot of work to do. This was unresolvable with the IT and front desk staff. Only one password given/allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, undergoing renovations”
Reviews.Author: Sam A
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ok, nothing out of the ordinary, two double beds and it was clean and fresh. We weren't advised when we booked that the loby area was undergoing major renovations so it didn't look very nice but otherwise it was a normal hotel. Oh but don't share a room with somebody that you don't want to get to know a little better, the bathroom door was glass and had a gap about 3cm wide in the middle, it didn't feel very private.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This NOVOTEL located in Mortreal downtown. It is very good place. You could found many good store very easily. But some problem is there is not hot water for bath. That is only pity one I feel not so well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but construction!!”
Reviews.Author: mickinge
Reviews.Content: After flying from Australia I was looking forward to a peaceful day rest. Unfortuneatley this hotel was having work done so rest was interrupted by drills and jackhammers. Staff were very understanding and tried to give me the quietest room on the top floor. I wasn't advised prior to the booking being made on my behalf. Now i understand why it was such a competitive price. Other than that nice rooms and a great in house restaurant. Only a minute walk from the Transfer Bus stop from the airport. After the works completed would certainly recommend to business and family travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the welcome”
Reviews.Author: walcottia
Reviews.Content: This was a clean and tidy hotel with a very nice comfortable bed and very well located for footslogging the city. Having taken a taxi from the railway station on our arrival we discovered that it was just a five minute walk away. We found the hotel was rather impersonal, even for a chain and on the whole it was the younger staff who were friendly.There was a free internet connection in the lobby.We did not use the restaurant as there were many more value-for-money options within a very short walk. We had a room at the front and did not find it unduly noisy or busy, but we are well used to cities and some people might disagree! This is a good hotel for location, but lacking in welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot”
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a few nights while in Montreal. I liked the fact that it was centrally located, had indoor parking and that the metro was close. We chose the newly renovated upgraded suite, which is a must if you choose this hotel. The check in was painless, the room was great with a comfortable bed. I love the fact that they had Nespresso machines in the room, what a treat! I will be returning and I was not the least bit disapointed. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jame_3355
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my boyfriend for a weekend getaway. I've stayed here before, and have been satisfied with my time here. Staff is always very pleasant. The rooms are basic, modern. Beds are comfortable, but pillows are a little drab. Also, don't expect much for a view. If you're planning on staying here in the next year be aware they are doing hard core renovations in the lobby.. it makes the place look a little ghetto but it doesn't really take away from anything, just the look of the hotel when you first walk in. We paid $20for parking for the whole time were, not too bad. Don't waste your time on the breakfast, lots of better places around. Location is really where your money is going to.. Bell Centre right across the street and St. Catherine is the next block up. We walked to Old Montreal no problem, everything is in reach. Overall decent hotel and I would go again!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Novotels around the world and found this one better than average, perhaps because we had a freshly renovated suite. The rates were reasonable considering the size and comfort of the accommodations. The hotel is centrally located and close to the Museum of Fine Arts, good restaurants, shopping, and theatres. This last is important to me, since I often go to Montreal to see plays. The one obstacle to my rating the hotel excellent was the fact that the entrance was being renovated, which made the lobby noisy and cramped. But, obviously, this is a temporary situation.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: guy22
Reviews.Content: I like the central location, Bell Centre, night life on Cresent St. Nice people working at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Row Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rich H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in this hotel It was a nice hotel right in the centre of montreal in a good location. The room was spacious and clean, it was what you would expect from a novatel â€“ a nice spacious clean hotel, nothing fancy but nothing poor either, service was friendly and good. Was not happy having to have to pay $20 a day parking, the hotel offered no discount to the daily parking rate even if you were a hotel guest or not. Was an added expense you donâ€™t need. Other than that everything else was average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jpc1974
Reviews.Content: I was entertaining 7 clients this past week and so glad I chose this hotel. Great staff, very bilingual, good food, great location, safe to walk the streets...awesome. (note: Lobby being renovated and will be ready by the end of 2011)

Reviews.Title: “Simplicity”
Reviews.Author: sleepyash
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location adjacent to the cool shops of St Catherines Street. It is also 50m from the Airport Express bus route which turned out to be fantastic. Not very far south is the Old Montreal, and also close to the town square. This is a superb location if you also like shopping. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel, Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lorralison
Reviews.Content: Just a stone's throw from the Bell Center and easy walking distance to great shopping this moderately priced hotel is perfect. Bright, clean rooms, lovely duvets on the beds, friendly staff- this hotel has it all. The restaurant may be a bit too upscale for families with small children but perfect for a weekend getaway for grown-ups. Fabulous shopping and restaurants all around. Perfect for a weekend or week away to relax, shop or catch a hockey game or concert.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, good rooms, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Tasi
Reviews.Content: Arrived very early off a cruise ship, no problems getting rooms but this time sister and her husband on different floor, no issues with this. Room was large and airy, clean and tidy and had everything we needed for our three nights in Montreal. Staff were very helpful and went out of their way to assist and provide advice - it was a pleasure to stay in this hotel.. It is very close to a wide variety of shops and restaurants, couldn't be better. I would stay here again and again and again - not the most luxurious but met our requirements and more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean and tidy large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy and efficient - front desk reception were bilingual so very helpful. Rooms were clean and large with wifi and a good selection of french and english TV channels. Bathroom was nice, but non-adjustable water pressure in the shower wasn't great. Room service menu reasonably priced, but so many restaurants within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Location was outstanding! Restaurants, main shopping strip, two metro stations and Mont-Royal within walking distance. Have stayed in another area of Montreal before (the Plateau) but would DEFINITELY RECOMMEND to a tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, no free wireless, expensive parking ($20 per day )”
Reviews.Author: crane9938
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was in a perfect location for shopping, restaurants, bars, an the Bell Center. Disappointed in the fact that we had to pay for wireless Internet ($6,95 per day) and parking ($20 per day). The rooms arevery nice and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Shannon_Robinson_88
Reviews.Content: Room was nice - we'd booked online through a wholesaler after calling the hotel (they would not match the rate, which I found odd). The room was plenty of space for 2 people for a few days. The bed was great. Only complaint about the room would be the bathroom door - it allowed all of the light to escape, so if someone got up to go to the bathroom late at night, the other person in bed might be disturbed by the light. Our room also did not have a "Do Not Disturb" sign for us to put out, so housekeeping often knocked on our door early in the morning. Wireless internet was free in the lobby, but not in the rooms. We ended up going to an internet cafe nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, clean and near everything !”
Reviews.Author: mutrax
Reviews.Content: Went to Montreal for business, stay 3 nights at the hotel. It's in downtown but I didn't hear any noise from the street or from other rooms. Bed was big and comfortable. Room and hallways very clean. Front desk was fast and friendly. Bathroom was very clean. Some minor problems (fawcet was loose and the flush "thing" was almost broken) but everything else was flawless. Only negative point : Internet connection isn't free.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected from a Novotel”
Reviews.Author: westie034
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, spacious. Staff were friendly and helpful, however long waits at reception for checking in and out or obtaining info , only 2 people on duty and everything seemed to take a long time resulting in queues. Breakfast was buffet style with nice selection of breads, however the scrambled eggs were lumpy, bacon looked grey and unappetising and fresh fruit was bruised and looked anything but fresh. Location was good for other restaurants and only couple of blocks from railway station, and metro

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: cp076
Reviews.Content: Staff was great in helping with directions. Only downside--there were no menus or fliers for takeaway/delivery restaurants. And no phone book in room.

Reviews.Title: “They didn't fulfill the internet deal.”
Reviews.Author: Renata09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July with my family, husband and two teenager girls. Poor service since the begginig. I had two executive room , they was priced, but the deal I got on hotel website was the breakfast included for 2 adults and 2 children till 16 years. But when I checked out they charged the children breakfast . OK, no problem, I just wont stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Reasonable, & Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Deltaghost8
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (located close to pretty much everything in downtown Montreal), friendly staff, and clean rooms make this Hotel a very good selection if your aren't looking for a super fancy place with all kinds of needless ammenities. It is somewhat basic (no Spa, etc), but you can't beat this place if your trying to avoid paying $150+ per night. Gym is fine and our bed was very comfortable (more so than the one we slept in at Tremblent at a much more expensive Westin). My girlfriend and I enjoyed our stay at the Novotel and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Late night saviour!”
Reviews.Author: RickyH1
Reviews.Content: Got the last room here on a weekend where every hotel in the area was booked. We only planned to be there for the day, but late Saturday we decided to stay over. The front desk staff were very accomodating with a late night walk-in and we were able to get toothbrushes/paste, etc. right there. Room was great, but just a tip - choose a higher floor on weekends to avoid late night/early morning street noise. Looked like a great buffet breakfast but a bit pricey so we wen't up to Ruebens on St. Catherine where they have a terrific breakfast for half the price. Would stay again - clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “When in Montreal, I always stay here! (I'm in Montreal A LOT!)”
Reviews.Author: MountainMel
Reviews.Content: I go to Montreal for work 3-4 times a year, and I ALWAYS stay at the Novotel. It is always clean, service is always good, and food is decent. I love the breakfast; small, simple, and well priced. They are always consistent with all of these things. It is also well priced. Some other things to note... If you need to park, they have good underground parking. You do have to pay for internet in your room, but it is fast. They have a computer in the lobby that you can use for free. They also have free Wi-Fi in the lobby. I should point out that I am a neat freak and relatively picky with food. I am also a vegetarian. This hotel is also in a good location right near Rue Ste-Catherine (A GREAT SHOPPING AREA!) and within walking distance of the Place Bonaventure (Convention Centre). I don't think the reviews people have posted on here have stayed here more than once. I also don't think they have tried other downtown Montreal Hotels, which generally are awful. I hope this helps! Happy travels! PS - The pub across the road is DELICIOUS! The itialian restaurant across the road is expensive and just OK. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel, Good value”
Reviews.Author: em_be53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2011. The location was fantastic, just around the corner from Rue St Catherine, the main shopping street and one or two streets up from two streets full of restaurants. Whilst we had to pay a bit for parking, the carpark was unlimited entry/exit for the overnight charge and the carpark attendant was very helpful and always reserved one of the easier/larger spaces for our giant rental SUV and was halpful in guiding us in and out of the space. The rooms were clean and ok, nothing special, but fairly standard for a Novotel. The front desk was interesting, with little pads in the lobby and help yourself apple PC terminals. We loved the bar out on the sidewalk and used it whilst the kids were having a nap for pre dinner drinks on both night we were there. It gives you a good feel for Montreal with outdoor dining available at the adjoining restaurant. Als very close to the bixi stations, so from the hotel, you can hop on a bike at be at canal Lachine, the old town, the plateau, mont Royal or anywhere else within a few minutes. We would stay here again definately.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place.”
Reviews.Author: lazy_artist88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night as I was on business. > Reception staff was very friendly, helpful, and professional > Meeting room was tired, stains on ceilings, paint on walls chipped or scuffed, electrical cords tapped to floor > Room was decent...as it was that new urban decor > room was clean, but a bit tired looking with carpet had big ripple in it > Bed was also "ok" but no sheet cover, mattress sheet had little hole, but nothing worrisome > Gym had new equipment, which was good, but only one floor mattress, and not cleaning spray bottle or paper towel to wipe down machine or matt after use > Breakfast was good, standard fare at hotel prices

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: schuminou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located down town Montreal. We got an executive room, the baby bed was ready at our arrival. There is a car park, do not go to the other ones around. Staff is really nice. I recommend this hotel for its global performance. I cannot tell about the breackfast, since we didn't test it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst nights we ever spent in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicaDificil
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to Montreal to visit McGill University. I reserved this hotel because I thought Novotel would be a guarantee for a good night sleep. It was quite the opposite! The room next door was full of people who spent the night partying, drinking, screaming. We could not sleep at all. The hotel personnel was very subdued and did not act. They seemed intimidated or disinterested. At 4:00 AM I had to personally fight with these people to get them to stop. I never experienced anything like it and I am a frequent traveler around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MellowYellow716
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for two nights at the end of July 2011 with my sister for a girls trip away. It was the perfect base from which to shop (Rue St. Catherine is only a block away) and the subway isn't far away either - we used it often to do some shopping outside the downtown area and to go to Parc Jean-Drapeau for a concert. This would also be the perfect place to stay for an event at the Bell Centre, it's practically across the street. We had a superior king room. The bed was comfortable and there was a sofa with a pull out bed underneath that looked comfortable too. The room was a good size for the two of us, but I thought it was strange that the bathroom had french doors so there was a crack in between and no lock, plus it had no fan or bathtub. The room looked like it had been updated a few years ago. We had a buffet breakfast included with our stay and it was very good. I would definitely stay here again, it was a very good value. The only cons were minor - it took them a little while to get to us at breakfast one day and we got our checkout time extended but they still deactivated the room key at noon.

Reviews.Title: “great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great! However: 1. there was no normal front desk, there were 2 little desk and the 2 people working were in no rush. 2. Our 2 double bed room, the rooms with a view are extremly small and the bathroom has no real door, no lock, no fan, no bathroom things(lotion,etc.) and was a bit busted up. 3. because it was so small the extra roll-away bed we requested, they said could not fit. 4. we finally got a room without the view, (looking at a opening in the middle of the hotel) that was bigger and got out the roll-away bed, the was room had a real door but still no lock, lotion, fan and those little things. 5. The gym has 1 universal and a couple bikes and tred mills, not what was expected. 6. No pool. The only good thing was the comfy bed and the location of this hotel. This 2nd room was ok since it was 4 guys but not sure if i would return with family.

Reviews.Title: “Great so far!”
Reviews.Author: nlcouple
Reviews.Content: Was greeted by a very friendly front desk staff in an attractive lobby. Novotel is in the heart of downtown Montreal and very close to Crescent Street. For a reasonable price we have a spacious room that is clean and contemporary. Our only problem so far is that when many hotels are offering free wireless Internet we are paying $9.95 per day for Internet service. With taxes over the next 4 days that will set us and the other couple with us back approximately $100 in our 2 rooms. Besides that, I would definitely recommend Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: romi120
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (July 29 to Aug 1) for a Bachelorette weekend. The hotel location was great. Walking distance to shops and restaurants and museums. The beds were comfortable and the size of the room was adequate. For a room that has 2 double beds, there was enough room to use a roll away bed and still feel like you're not on top of each other. Just some minor complaints though, but very minor that it wouldn't change my decision to stay here again...The TV system was frustrating. I couldn't channel surf. I had to commit to a station before knowing what's on it. Also, the maids wouldn't refill the disposable cups. I didn't ask for anymore, but had ran out before our last night there. All in all, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good price and next to shopping on St.Catherine”
Reviews.Author: grmartineau
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novotel last week - good price approx. $128 for 2 people. I would stay again because of price and location. Typical Novotel, simple furniture (IKEA style), 4 star, 9 floors, located in downtown Montreal. Half block from St.Catherine street, which is great for shopping and eating, and a couple of blocks from the metro - Peel Station. Room is medium size with comfortable bed. Don't like the French doors for bathroom though and no vent. Breakfast is optional, good, but expensive (about $15 / p). Parking is also optional. It is a 6$ taxi ride from train station to get to hotel - by the way I don't recommend taking subway (metro) from train station. Limited signs at train station (small, not obvious) and when get off at Lucien L'Allier station, you still have to walk 2 blocks uphill. However, from hotel, you can walk to Peel Street and take subway - line brings you to Centre des Arts (Just for Laugh) as well as Biodome, stadium, etc. further East (Metro Pass $8 day or $16 for 3 days). All in all, I would stay again because of location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Feel”
Reviews.Author: MrTravel007
Reviews.Content: Okay sure i can always add negative things but overall this was a refreshing surprise. Things i read before that are helpful to keep in mind. 1. Stay at least on the 3rd floor or higher if you are on the "street side" 2. They charge for internet only $9.95 for 24 hours but still this day and age it should be free 3. I stayed accross from the Ice/ Pop machine so not the best for that if people are thirsty, can be noisy 4. No pool or hot tub 5. Parking can get costly, but you can park across the street for cheaper i believe 6. Dont think the walls are two thick so if you have noisy neighbours that could be BAD 7.Oh and the meals can be a bit pricy but Montreal usually is, my advice go to the "3 Brothers" not sure how to say it in French Okay good things: 1. i found the staff friendly and helpful, love their front desk, you will see when you get here :) 2. Modern feel, not so "Chain" hotel like, that is boring and the same like Holiday Inn's, but if consistant is what you like then go to a bigger "chain" :) 3. Seems to have been updated recently 4. Great restaurant patio 5. Clean rooms, not huge but sufficient 6. In the low 50's out of roughly 165 hotels in Montreal, i would give it closer to 40 :) Hope u find this info helpful

Reviews.Title: “it was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i became really surprised with the level of this novotel in montreal , excelent in service , attention , good rooms , location is perfect , in summary , i was really positively surprised , comparing with I have seen from same level accor hotels around the world.. keep the focus on that level of quality and service and will go up ! pedro palo sanos platinun card member

Reviews.Title: “Montreal Concert Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal for a concert at the Bell Centre. This Novotel is a very close to the Bell Centre and to shopping. Walking distance to everything!! We ate one meal at the hotel restaurant - it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs or Fleas Room 213”
Reviews.Author: eibach90
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this particular Novotel before and had no issues, but last week I was in Montreal on business and had a bad experience in Room 213. Awoke from a great night of sleep, headed down stairs for breakfast when my upper body, from waist up, started to itch like never before. Following breakfast I went up to the room removed my shirt and noticed a series of welts (15+). Rushed out to attend my meeting without notifying the staff until I notified them via hotel survey on line. Might of been just this particular room but take care if you get room 213...........

Reviews.Title: “Location and service very good; rooms; not comfortable with teenagers.”
Reviews.Author: Yossi95 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The sofa bed is not suitable for teenagers. The queen size bed has a good size but was not comfortable since it was old and very much used. Generally the location is excellent. Breakfast is very good. Service is good, but they can't change the room for you (I can understand that).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: djeriz
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight during the Canada Day long weekend so the hotel reception staff was busy when we got there. Staff were very helpful, although I found them not that knowledgeable about the area. Before checking-in, they ask you to park at an underground parking lot for an extra charge. We ended up using a parking lot down the street because our 11 seater van would not fit the hotel parking lot. The rooms were clean and well-kept. We had no problem with any of their facilities. The hotel is close to the Bell Centre and shopping on Rue de Catherine so the location is really great. It is about a 20 minute walk to Chinatown and Old Montreal. There a lot of restaurants around although if you're a Tim Horton's fan like we were, it was a bit of a trek to the closest one. All in all, we had a good stay and would definitely go back for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel ! Friendly and helpful staff,clean room everyday, comfortable mattress,hot water,contemporary decoration, safe neighborhood, one block from Bell Centre.Will definitely recommend to others for all reasons!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Location, close to everything, nice clean room, the staff was great and we were able to walk everywhere and even the Metro was close by to use and great shopping stores within a stones throw from the Hotel. Parking was good and the Hotel was easy to find. I will be returning to my hometown and I will be staying at this Hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Gigibmc
Reviews.Content: We had a very late check in (12:30am) with two children (4 and 15 months). The gentleman at the front desk (Max..I think) was pleasant and helpful. Gave the kiddies some toys and stuffed animals. Check-in was quick and easy, and he gave us a parking pass. The room was clean, nothing spectacular but clean. The furniture was ok, didn't really like the light brown painted wood desk and side table. But the arm chairs were nice and clean. (yes cleanliness is very important to me!). They had a nice breakfast buffet but a bit pricey (16.99) and the a la carte menu was pricey too. The staff at the restaurant was nice and attentive speaking both english and french. Good thing we were right downtown and just walked a few minutes to St. Catherine to a myriad of restaurants-Reubens has an excellent menu for EVERYTHING!!!! The staff was really helpful when we had questions about locations of various places and how to get there by subway (metro). All in all had a nice stay and the kiddies enjoyed themselves. It is in a great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ccole1112
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Novotel for about 4 days on business. Room was OK although a little dated. I was told to ask for one of the updated rooms on the upper floors, not sure if I got one or not, but I was on the 2nd so i think not? I would definitely try to get a room on an upper floor since there may be some noise from the street below as well. Price was on par with other hotels of similar class. Service was good. Location is very good as this hotel is just a couple blocks from Rue St. Catherine. There is a large selection of restaurants around. There is also a metro station less about a 5 minute walk away (assuming your there in the summer).

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay. No pool :(”
Reviews.Author: tmc88
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted by the friendly staff. Our travel agent had stuffed up and booked us the wrong room but they fixed it up for us no problem!! Rooms were very comfortable. Great location. Very close to shopping.. Found lots of bargains. Only thing I didn't like was the fact that you had to pay for wifi in the room but if your in the reception area it's free... Didn't make too much sense to me. I would have thought because I'm a paying customer I would get free wifi. And also the fact it didn't have a pool. It was a hot day when we got there and the only thing we wanted to do was go for a swim... But couldn't. Over all the stay was great. Staff were great and location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: FrankPF
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in this hotel during the 'Francofolies' festival, and didn't regret it. We had first thought to book at the Sofitel thinking it would be better located and have higher standards, but this hotel was just fine. The room was clean and spacious enough, and good enough value for what we paid. This was our first trip to Montreal and we wanted to make sure to not be far from the main tourist areas. As several fellow trip advisors pointed out, this Novotel is located very near to the Saint Catherine street which is one of the main shopping streets here. The old port area is further away, but the 20-30 min walk there is a pleasant one. We did not have breakfast at the hotel since we wanted to have crepes. Again, on nearby St. Catherine's street there's a plethora of small to large eating venues to choose from. All in all, a good memory, and we'll probably chose this hotel again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: NMcMah0n
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were a family travelling. Room was newly renovated, views were wonderful, staff were helpful and the computer downstairs was a nice touch. However the minibar security device and Wi-fi access pricing was excessive, the Hotel restaurant was expensive - we went elsewhere, and the design of the room didn't readily lend itself to family occupation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: T_Virdee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great central location. The room was average, however the bed was very flimsy and the pillows were lifeless, I didn't sleep properly a single night. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Shabby”
Reviews.Author: gsalini
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends for a weekend in April 2011. The place is located in a good area, near all shops. The hotel is run-down very badly. Ripped carped...cracked tiles...ripped out baseboards....Hair on new towels and bed....and unbelievably bad air circulation. For what you pay you can say it is acceptable, but it is far from okay considering novotel hotels are decent. Also, our room card had to be re-activated numerous times b/c they were all worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated in downtown”
Reviews.Author: jcardona15
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its location (Downtown) and the price ($107/night). I took the bus from the airport (for $8) and was happy to find that it was a very short walk from the bus stop on Drummond. Check in was a snap, and the wonderful young lady at the front desk also gave me some wonderful restaurant referrals and some things to add to my to do list. I was pleasantly surprised by my room, which was spacious and had a nice modern feel to it. The hallways were clean, but it had an incomplete feel to it as the baseboards were missing. The free wifi was hit or miss in the lobby area but there is a computer w/ internet access for you to use. Parking is $20 a day, and I am glad my rental car plans did not work out. The Metro in Montreal is first rate, though I found myself walking a lot due to the beautiful weather. I did not partake in the restaurant save for the breakfast buffet which was a bit pricey ($16) and mediocre. The location of the Novotel is prime. The Bell Center is a hop and skip, and St. Catherine street is half a block up rue de la Montagne. The nearest Metro in on Peel, which is about 3 blocks away. This hotel is definitely one I would go back to. The staff was helpful and the location was ideal. I would recommend to my fellow travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: flyboyaircan
Reviews.Content: I travel and stay at Novotel alot but have to say my first time at this hotel there was a one thing that I did not like. First I must say the renovations are nice - the hotel is modern and location is excellent. The thing that bothered me was that upon returning at 2:30pm the room had not been cleaned yet. Upon calling they sent someone up who was in a hurry and seemed unprepared to clean. I actually saw her take the two glasses and clean them with her hands in the tub with water running. and dry them with dirty towel - yes this is true. Other than that which grossed me out but the front desk staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Bell Centre and Ste. Catherine Street Shopping.”
Reviews.Author: newf1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Montreal Centre in February 2011 for 3 nights (Thursday - Sunday). Our purpose of this trip was a hockey weekend in Montreal and we couldn't have picked a more suitable hotel, at least location wise. It is literally across the parking lot from the Bell Centre. We could look out our window and see the arena. Check-in went smoothly - we were on our way to the 9th floor in no time. I will say I was a bit scared when I got off the elevator on the 9th floor to a wall full of fresh plaster. They were doing renovations to the hallways and carpeting on the 9th floor. Other than that first morning there, it was pretty much a non-issue. There were working by 8am but that didn't matter since we were up early on and on the go. By the time we returned Friday evening, it was completed (new wallpaper) and everything was taken away. The room - I would consder average. Beds were decent with good bedding (white duvets, etc). The bathroom was the highlight - very nice, but the shower lacked pressure. Overall, good value for the money. We did eat in the restaurant for a light breakfast. Be prepared to pay hotel prices - $15 breakfast buffett - we had a "trio" for $8 which was toast, and any two choices of something from a contential menu (cereal, fruit, etc). Another highlight is the great location and proximity to Ste. Catherine Street. You're just half a block away from the major shopping/restaurant district in Montreal. I would recommend eating Breakfast at "Reuben's Deli, Desserts and Steaks" on Ste. Catherine. An amazing breakfast menu for great prices. Very nice inside place too. Overall, I'd stay here again if I could get an average rate of $99 - $119 (which we did). Any more than that I would look into the Sheraton or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a good stay at the Novotel. It is located in a good area and is nearby a lot of restaurants. They are in the process of some renovations, so the hallway smelled like new paint, but it didn't smell in our room and didn't affect our stay at all. There is an in-room safe and the room was quite spacious, with a small sofa. The one drawback was that the internet in the rooms was not free. They did, however, have free wi-fi in the lobby and a computer in the lobby that was free to use. Overall, a good business hotel which is a better value than the other business hotels in the area, for comparable quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ILv2Trvl78
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, I got one of the updated rooms so it was very nice. Front desk staff was very professional and polite. I was however charged for phone calls to my credit card company's toll-free number. I wish I had disputed that as it was not listed anywhere that local calls cost money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & got a great price”
Reviews.Author: jmarynowski
Reviews.Content: A two minute walk just south of Rue St. Catherine (restaurants, shops, entertainment) - our stay at Novotel was great. Rooms were clean and spacious enough for the three of us (we had a double room). Be careful with minifridge - everything is controlled by sensors and automatically charged to your room. We got our double room at a great price, especially given the location, which made the stay that much better. The attached restaurant was also great, especially for breakfast ($8 for a huge breakfast!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: THe weather was very bad so a warm welcoming hotel was very welcome. The Restaurant was very good and service better than a lot of hotels. Only problem was that the hotel was undergoing restoration and therefore the state of decoration in the corridors left something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Roots1642
Reviews.Content: This Hotel,is the Hotel to stay at,if you want to go to a Hockey game or concert at the Bell Centre in downtown Montreal. Its close to everything you want (Bell Centre,Old Montreal,Place Ville Marie for shopping,and many very good places to eat), From this Hotel you can walk to anywhere you want to see Montreal. Very good location. We will stay at this Hotel,every time because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Centre Bell!!!!”
Reviews.Author: missforetwenty
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel previously. It is not as sexy as the neighboring Le Crystal but it is nice and an awesome location to crash after hitting up a concert at Centre Bell. We attended the Roger Waters performance of The Wall. A lot of people complain about parking charges...don't. You should expect it and the parking garage is clean and safe. It may seem scary to pull in with a giant SUV or something...tight quarters down there and be prepared to use your parallel parking skills if it gets close to being full. The beds are comfy enough. Do not disturb the mini fridge or water bottles on the desk upon entry of your room!! We have never been charged, but I have read reviews of idiots who have...and well..common sense should have played a bigger role there. The staff is very courteous and bilingual. There is also a nice pub across the street. We will probably stay at this hotel everytime we attend a concert at Centre Bell.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: danaevc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel hotel for 3 nights and everything was perfect! The staff was great and helpful, the room was spacious, comfortable and had a refrigerator. We stayed on the last floor so we had a nice view. We slept very well.. we didn't hear any sound coming from outside. It is located 2 minutes walking from St Catherine Street and a block away from the Bell Center. The only ''down'' side is that the free wifi is only in the lobby, but you can pay to have it in your room. I would recommend this hotel to anybody and would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great :-)”
Reviews.Author: Rasta_Baby_1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Montreal Centre for 8 nights and could wait to write this review, check-in was fast and friendly, got a room at the front side, but I didnâ€™t hear anything from the street (traffic, nightlife), room was spacious and very clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean and roomy. All of the staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast is awesome, lotâ€™s of choices, good start for the day! The location of the hotel is amazing nightlife, microbreweries, restaurants are located within a 5 minute walk from the hotel on Cresent Street and St. Catherine. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: madglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed for only 2 nights on my first trip to Montreal. The check in/out process was fast and they even helped direct me on where to go and how to get there. I also got a free drink pass but didn't end up using it. What I liked the most was that it was conveniently situated near downtown, which is where you spend most of your time shopping, dining and nightlife. Old Montreal is about 10 minutes away and costs about 15 dollars. Not bad for a last minute trip.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel in Montreal is well located and in a safe and secure location.The staff is stable and friendly.The rooms are of adequate quality and some upgrading work has been undertaken.

Reviews.Title: “Check about renovations before you go!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCrzr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and overall not a bad hotel. Good location, decent value for the money. Rooms were reasonable, if not exactly spotless. Biggest problem on this last trip is that the hotel was undergoing renovations - not listed on their website or when I checked in. There was no fitness facilities at all - I managed to find the room, but it was dark with mattresses stored there etc. No temporarily facilities setup or offered. The staff was reasonably apologetic, but no solution was offered. Checked out after my first night and moved to another hotel in the area. Would perhaps consider going back here, but only once the renovations are done.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills But OK”
Reviews.Author: Journeyboomers
Reviews.Content: Check in quick and friendly. Close to good restaurants around corner. Short walk to city centre. Ask for wi fi for lobby not free for room. Restaurant food good but dear.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: Was a little dissapointed with the front desk on arrival. There seemed to be alot of people around with only 1 woman on the front desk. I must say we did arrive about lunch time and knew we were early but decided to try and check in early as we had been early as some other hotels on our holiday and were able to check in without a problem, but unfortuantely our room was not ready but we were able to put our bags into a room while we dropped our rental car off. We did return about 2 hours later to find that our room was ready and we were impressed with the room. This hotel is in an excellent location and walking distance to just about everything. We managed to find a supermarket to buy a few bits and pieces and we grateful for the Tim Hortons coffee just down the road. Rooms were very clean and I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thehaslams1
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is not a giant skyscraper but it is well placed clean modern and up to date for example flat screen telly and a glass door into the shower no horrible shower curtain! We really enjoyed our stay of three nights and would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the lack of service”
Reviews.Author: ronniecat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from September 29 to October 2 while attending a business meeting, on the recommendation of a colleague I was traveling with. The location of the hotel is excellent - right in downtown Montreal, close to the Bell Centre and one block from Rue St. Catherine. Unfortunately my experience at this hotel was not positive, although I went prepared to like it as my co-worker recommended it highly. I am a very easy-going and positve traveler (check my other reviews) and travel with a good attitude, but this hotel left me frustrated. On the morning after my first night, I asked if someone could help me turn on the closed-captioning on the television because I am severely hearing-impaired. I had tried repeatedly without success. Despite repeated requests throughout my stay, nobody could ever do so. On my second night I decided to have dinner in the hotel's restaurant, L'O. After waiting a very long time to be seated in spite of the many empty tables, I was taken to a booth where I was promptly forgotten. After about fifteen minutes I was given a menu; it was approximately 20 minutes later when someone remembered to take my order. After I finished my meal, there was an interminable wait before someone brought the cheque. Dinner took 1 and 1/2 hours - not unreasonable if dining with companions and conversation, but entirely too long for someone dining alone. On my last day in town, I rushed back to the hotel on a break in my meeting (in a nearby building) to print my boarding pass to save time when getting my flight. The computer was an Apple, one of which I haven't used in a decade or more, and I wasted precious time trying to figure out how to open a browser. I had to ask for help which meant trying to attract the attention of one of the front desk staff without losing my place at the internet station. (Note to Novotel - Apples are very fine computers I'm sure but they're NOT what business travelers are familiar with. And we don't have time to take a "remedial hipness" course when traveling on business.) When I was finally able to check into my flight online and printed my boarding pass, it came out a pale, pale grey, white-streaked mess because of an empty ink cartridge. It certainly wasn't going to be possible to use. I pointed this out to a front desk staff person and her response was to remove the ink cartridge and shake it back and forth a few times. I have no idea if it helped (I doubt it, that cartridge was really near-dead) because the website wouldn't let me print it again anyway. I had to get a new one at the airport, which cost me time. The hotel is very well located, reasonably priced at $139, and the rooms are quite chic (even if they do hide the hair dryers in a drawer - I found mine by accident during a room check to make sure I hadn't left anything behind on checkout) and has the potential to be a great stay, but the attention to service is sorely lacking. They don't have comment cards and I believe I understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: OneWearyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely awful. While the Customer Service Rep was very pleasant, he was also very slow causing a line to form in the lobby. The decor is outdated and unappealing. The rugs in the hallways are full of stains. The room was smaller than expected and DIRTY. There was old toothpaste crusted in the bathroom sink and hair in the bathtub. The lid to the ice bucket had old dried up food stuck to it. The shower was broken and when my husband called the desk to have it fixed, he was told simply that the repair man had left for the day. He complained about the dirty bathroom and requested that it be cleaned while we were out for the night. We returned to find the same dirty bathroom - no one had come to clean it. Against my better judgement, we ate breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. I should have gone with my gut and ate out, but we had already paid for the buffet (included with the price of the pre-paid room). Two bites in to the scrambled eggs and I found myself picking a piece of plastic out of my mouth (part of the seal around a water bottle or something like that). All they offered us for our trouble was free parking. On the way out, the last thing I saw was a huge house centipede crawling around the doorframe. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: kingtao
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novetel Montreal Centre for two nights and could wait to write this review to warn readers to stay away. Room that we had stayed was dirty and tiny. The carpet looked like it had never been cleaned or vacuumed as there were stains throughout. I found a discarded bottle cap and used tissue on the floor, after we had to wait for an hour and half for the housekeeping maid to clean it before we could check in. The housekeeping maid was grouchy and moody, and did not even bother to repond when I greeted her in the morning. Service from check in to check out was awlful. When I mentioned the poor state of our room to the front desk at check out, all I got was a "oh". Parking was terrible, and yet it charges $20 per night for it. The only good thing was its location, but there are at least a dozen other hotels in the vicinity and I believe they cost more or less the same as this Novetel. I have stayed at other Novetel hotels and this one definitely ranks last and cannot measure up to the other Novetel hotels. It is surely a mystery how it got a 4-star rating as I would not even give it a one-star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but room for improvement on some things”
Reviews.Author: Adam081
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in July - great location, right downtown, near everything. Had a room to the front with a pleasant view over the street. Some staff are very helpful. Some things could be improved. Check-in can be slow, with queues forming at times. The way the reception is set up with two small desks means that some fellow guests crowd around as you check in - not great for privacy. Internet access is available at just one computer beside the reception at a similar desk - always busy, and often had children using it! Rooms are spacious and comfortable. But the carpet is filthy - don't walk in barefeet! Timing of cleaning service is haphazard - always seemed to come at the end of the day, around 4 or 5pm, which is not great when you've just returned from being out all day. Alarm clock in room is very dated, and radio didn't work. Didn't use the restaurant, but there is a nice outdoor terrace - service seems to be mainly in the evenings - was there one afternoon and waitress came to put something in menu display at entrance, but chose not to ask me if I wanted to order! All in all, a pleasant hotel, if you don't mind a few quibbles.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...with tiny minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: MarieF59
Reviews.Content: Check in took a long time, but that's only because their was a line up...which is nobody's fault. It could actually be a good sign. I booked this hotel through the official Novotel website and what I found odd is that you had to prepay right away for the hotel, like the entire total. It's not a big deal to me, I actually liked the fact that you could do because it makes it easier to manage money. When you've already paid for it you don't have to worry about the money once you get there. Ok, so after that, the room was clean. (The photos I added were taken right as I was leaving the room, so please note that things are obviously not as clean as when I got there.) The mini bar has censors, which is smart, but it's so expensive, it's pretty much useless, I wish it was a plain fridge instead...but that's just personal opinion. Other thing is that to get into the elevators to go up to the rooms, after 6pm you need to swipe your room card...which is great security, I liked that about the hotel. The restaurant L'O is fantastic! Great food, cute bar and wonderful little private seating areas...definitely made my boyfriend and I's supper more romantic. All in all, I recommend it, good price, pretty much an average hotel that does the job, no big wow factor...but I'm ok with that, are you? Oh but I am forgetting the wonderful big Mac computer in the lobby is great for looking up directions if you don't have a laptop...

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: sobley
Reviews.Content: I found a deal for $99/night and seeing how nice the pictures and reviews seemed to be (for the most part) I booked this hotel for my vacation. The location is excellent - 2 blocks walk from the 747 bus from the airport, and right between the orange and green lines for the metro. The room was very comfortable, with the only downsides being the filthy floor (seriously, bring socks or flip flops, because you are not going to want to walk barefoot on these floors). The bed was very comfy as well, with a selection of different types of pillows in the room. The overall size of the room was pretty spacious as well. The soundproofing was odd - I never heard a single noise from the rooms on either side of me, and yet the door let in tons of noise from the hallway (screaming people on Friday night, the ice machine, ect). The front desk staff was ok. Some of the people working there were very friendly and helpful, while others were extremely cold and borderline rude. The internet connection is free in the lobby and I never had a problem taking advantage of that (although you have to ask a front desk staff for the password the first time that you use it). My room was on the 4th floor, and there were times when I could even access the free lobby internet from my room, which was nice. Overall I'm very glad that I booked this hotel, I just wish that they would steam clean the room floors more often.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Boogalie
Reviews.Content: The first thing we were greeted by was the cold mood of the front desk lady. Service here is so so. These people don't go the extra mile. It's more of you get what you paid for attitude. I hated how the fridge was tiny and all sensored. You can't keep your own anything in it without first explaining that you did not consume whatever was in it but just took it out so you can use the space for your own stuff. . It was disappointing that they did not carry tourist booklets at the lobby just a flyer for tourist attraction. A booklet is more useful because you can carry around all the maps, places to eat and see etc. There was an info tourist center a few blocks a way where you can find more information. Guest can use the MAC computer at the lobby. but it is only one computer. If you bring your laptop you can use it at the lobby for free internet. The location was perfect. Take the express bus from the airport and it will drop you off at a corner in Rene Levesque where it will only be less than 5 minute walk to the hotel. The location is between to metro stations green and orange but closer to the Lucien L'allier station. Close to St. Catherine's for shopping and Maissoneuve for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location is the Only Good Thing”
Reviews.Author: Lisastars7
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Montreal where you can just park and walk to just about anywhere you want to go, the Novotel is good for that. Reasonably priced - less than $150 a night - it's ok if you aren't planning to spend much time in the hotel itself. There must be 5 or 6 restaurants on every block. It's within walking distance to the Green Line Metro and St. Catherine St which is huge for shopping (if you're a size 4 or smaller and into the club scene). But the hotel itself leaves much to be desired. The room was only passably clean, especially the bathroom. We had a double room and the beds were comfortable and the sheets looked clean. The towels were small, very rough and many of the stained. The housekeeping staff is numerically challenged. We had 3 people in our room. One day, they left us 4 bath towels and 1 wash cloth. Then we had no toilet paper. I had to ask 4 times for extra wash cloths & toilet paper and was promised each time they would be brought to the room - never happened. The next morning, I finally got a front desk person who responded to my request. There is a restaurant in the hotel which has a passable breakfast buffet, not exorbitantly priced. Bottom line, if you want to sightsee and are just looking for someplace to hang your hat for a few days, the Novotel is ok, but don't expect anything great. And you might want to bring extra washcloths & toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: alottapickles
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights at the hotel. Location is great, within 2-5 min walking distance to many bus stops, metro lines, restaurants, shops and Bell Center. One block away from CAAA (note: if you have AAA stop by the Drummond St. office to get free maps and info). The tourist info. center is a 5-10 min walk and is a MUST for information. Hotel itself is pretty clean EXCEPT for the carpets (don't think they vaccum daily), do NOT walk on carpet with just socks unless you want your white socks to become brown. Front desk agents for the most part are extremely helpful, a few could use an attitude adjustment but overall pretty knowledgeable and wiling to help you get what you need whether it's hours of operation, directions or suggestions. FREE WIFI IN LOBBY ONLY and local/toll free calls do cost $1.50 with restrictions. Didn't do breakfast in the restaurant but did do hot chocolate and desert, not the greatest but okay for the price. Hotel pretty quiet for the most part except on the weekend there was A LOT of noise from different rooms on our floor. Called to complain to front desk and did actually hear security come up to talk to the individuals as we weren't the only ones to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Can be better”
Reviews.Author: Exyu14
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pritty clean and nice. Front desk stuff can be more polite and then can put some smile on their faces. Carpet in rooms looks diry and i believe there was some bugs, i mean i didnt see any but carpet looks like that. Washroom was very clean and with a lot of light. Some strange small was all the time in room but in general was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience at Novotel Montreal”
Reviews.Author: taraboc
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Novotel Montreal Hotel was absolutely horrible. While on vacation with my fiance, my iPhone was stolen out of my room and then destroyed. Overall, my experience was horrible and one that I will never forget. What is most upsetting is not that my phone was stolen from my room. It was the way the hotel dealt with the matter and the suspicious story we were told about the missing phone. My iPhone was removed from my room and was miraculously found only after I stated that I would need to talk to corporate because there was now a threat of potential identity theft. I was told that the phone was found in the laundry but it was damaged beyond use and that it was unfortunate but out of the hotel's control. The hotel sent me my phone and it was very interesting that the phone was missing its case, which was a very tightly fitting protective shell. It is evident that someone removed the phone from the case. Furthermore, the damage was clearly not due to being washed in the laundry machine. Instead, it looked as if someone smashed the face of the phone with a hammer. The back of the iPhone was completely in tact. Again, the case would NOT have come off and thus, it is proof that someone removed the phone from the case. Lastly and most importantly, the phone had no water damage as the hotel claimed. Whether it was the housekeeper's negligence or not, the hotel is ultimately responsible for my damaged property. I feel like I was robbed by both the maid and the hotel. Worse then having my personal property stolen, was management's lack of response. It took nearly 2 weeks and a message to Novotel corporate for the GM to respond to my emails. The GM finally emailed me after 2 weeks to say that he would be willing to share some of the cost to replace my phone. However, when I responsed that I would be amenable to this situation and would like more information on how to proceed, I did not receive a reponse. It has been nearly 2 weeks and I have yet to hear anything from him... I doubt I ever will. Sadly, my fiance and I lost our last night in Montreal because of this ordeal. While we will never stay at a Novotel hotel again we are planning to return to Montreal, but this time stay at a hotel that values its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Want a great place to stay for playoff hockey? DON'T stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am never one to complain. I'm always skeptical of negative reviews here because each person can have a different experience. That being said, I'm compelled to share mine. I chose Novotel for it's reasonable price, decent reviews, and wonderful location. Also, the rooms on their website looked good. It's amazing how photography can be used to make things look better. Our first room was an absolute pit. We wanted to leave right away, but couldn't since the hotel was pre-paid through Travelocity. The stains throughout the room were not very inviting. They were on the pillows couch mostly. We thought we walked into a sleazy motel. The sheets had random black hairs on them, I guess that was just from the maid though. The mattress wasn't as nice as what you'd get in a college dorm, though it was a queen size. Naturally, I asked that we'd be given another room, and they obliged. It was at least cleaner, but came with it's own problems. My fiancÃ© wil write the review on that one. If you are looking for a decent place to stay, with a reasonable price tag, do yourself a favor and stay at the Quality Inn on Crescent!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: GeorgesTannous
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 13 nights , it is the best location in Montreal downtown, near the bell center , next to saint catherine street , 2 min walking distance to metro station lucien d'allier. i had a great view from my window's room , everything was perfect staff were very friendly and professional,they have one of the best breakfast buffet in town. it was really a pleasure to stay in this magnificent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Right handy to the Bell Centre, Rue St. Catharine & Crescent”
Reviews.Author: NBHabsfan
Reviews.Content: My buddy & I were i town for a boys Habs weekend, taking in Sat & Sun afternoon hockey games at the Bell Centre. We shared a room with a queen size bed & pull out couch. I lost the coin toss & got the pull out, & i'll tell you it was the most comfortable pull out I've ever slept on. The room was fine although we were ony on the 2nd floor do had a view of an alley & a lower level roof, but it was quite comfortable. I'd read a previous comment about the bathroom door having frosted glass & being a privacy issue, but it was a non issue. Unground parking was I think $20 a night, not cheap, but handy & the only meal we had there was breakfast one morning, chose the buffet, it was quite good, all the usual items, done well, with the bonus of cheese bread, croissants, quiche, & individually packaged cheddar & marble cheese. It wasn't cheap ($16 each I think) but it served us well that morning. There were only 2 bath towels in the room which was a surprise, we could have got more sent up i suppose, but we didn't ask, but it surprised me nonetheless. Wifi was at a charge in the room, but free in the lobby I believe, thought it should be a standard by now. ** General commentary here not just directed at the Novotel ** Jeepers, Holiday Inn Express has free Wifi, why do these higher end hotels continue to try to grab your wallet from you for something so basic these days?)

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Wiener SÃ¤nger
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located, 20 minutes walk from the old town. To save time, it is 5 minutes walk to four metro stations, Lucien d'Allier or Bonaventure on the orange line, or Peel / Guy Concordia, both on the green line. It is also walking distance to the Queen of the World Cathedral, the Central Gare and Place Bonaventure. The rooms are well sizes (Novotel standard) with modern-looking fake-wood WC doors. There are coffee making facilities in room. Stayed here for 3 days, and saw most of the city (we had a car too). The reception is friendly and efficient, and are well informed. I would stay here again. The main shopping streets and the Montreal Symphony Hall are within walking distance too. Internet is not free in room, but there is a wi-fi hotspot in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: misterfisher2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Drove a rental car in from Burlington Vermont airport [thanks, TripAdvisors!] and the Hertz GPS found the address with no trouble. Parked, checked-in and in room in less than thirty minutes. Very comfortable, large room with a nice bath/shower. Clean and fresh. Staff was always helpful, welcoming. Internet access set up in the lobby was a lifesaver, and free. [I think they had wifi and an in-room port, but I don't travel with the laptop, so I'm not sure.] A nice bar across the street, excellent restaurants and museums within walking distance. Close to the Metro. A lovely city, a great hotel. I'll go again in 2011 if they sign the Formula One contract! Parking was $18 per day, with in and out for free, but the desk waived my two day parking because they hadn't fixed the toilet occasionally running I had reported.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vancouvergoalie
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel for $60 USD via Priceline. The underground parking is convenient, and we're located right between Rene Levesque and St. Catherine's street. So awesome location! The Bell Centre is right across the street! Each room had a King bed with a pull out sofa (queen size), so easily slept five of us in one room (2 kids, 3 adults); and the other room had two adults. Apparently there's a workout room but I don't know if there's a pool... I think there was. There's only one free internet computer available in the lobby, but I was told there's free wifi in the lobby if you bring your own laptop. I only stayed one night so never found out. The breakfast buffet is decent (about $16 CND ). I'd definitely stay again. And the only downside was the staff service was nonexistent. We felt ignored the few times we went downstairs to ask a question.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOMS & GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: KatePerth
Reviews.Content: During our travels around the East Coast of Canada, my husband and I had a two night stay in Montreal and after reviews on Trip Advisor booked the Novotel Montreal Center. We were not disappointed. The location of the hotel was fantastic, just around the corner from Rue St. Catherine and close to heaps of reasonably priced restaurants, bars and shops. The underground city access is also close by and this is amazing with it's myriad of shopping and eating options. Our room at the Novotel was huge. I understand from one of the housekeeping staff, they are not all that large so I guess we were lucky. The beds were amazingly comfortable and the bathroom clean and roomy. There was a safety deposit box in the room. Front office staff were efficient but not super friendly. There is a restaurant in the hotel but we didn't try it - must be popular as it was always fairly full with customers. Located across from the hotel is a great pub showing all the latest football games etc. The hotel is approximately 1/2 walk from the old town. We would have not hesitation whatsoever in staying at this property again if visiting Montreal....it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, too far”
Reviews.Author: chucho_nordes
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was spacious and well decorated and it had a superb buffet breakfast. The hotel personnel was very pleasant and efficient and the facilities looked great although I didn't have time to use them. The main problem I would mention is the hotel location, since the only transportation available is the taxi. There is also a shuttle service to the airport that runs every 30 min., but I had expected for a hotel with "airport" in its name to be closer.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price and Best Location”
Reviews.Author: MRJNovaScotia
